title: Operator Daily Maintenance of Crawler Tractors

tasks.task: Pre-start check of a crawler tractor.
subtasks: Inspect crawler attachment for worn or damaged parts.
Check tracks for worn sprocket teeth, oblong seat, worn pins and bushings, and smooth rollers.
Inspect hydraulic fluid hoses for cracks and pinching.
Check blade angle and lift cylinders for hydraulic leaks.
Look for fluid leaks in the engine compartment, including radiator, coolant, and cylinder seals.
Check fluid levels of engine coolant, engine oil, and hydraulic oil.
Drain potentially contaminated fuel from the tank.
Inspect engine's air filter system, including pre-cleaner screen and air filter elements.
Check battery connections and fill with distilled water if needed.
Record hours of engine operation for scheduling maintenance.
Ensure all personnel are clear of tractor.
Start engine and let it idle for 5-10 minutes to build oil pressure and reach operating temperatures.
Listen for engine and equipment noises. Check gauges for oil pressure, hydraulic pressure, temperature, and fuel levels.
Test steering clutches and brakes.
Monitor engine noises and gauges for unusual activity during operation.
Check track adjustment to ensure proper tightness.
Park the tractor on a level surface, rest attachments on the ground, set parking brake.
Idle engine for 5 minutes before shutdown.
Refill fuel tank and clean fuel lines.
Apply lubrication as per manufacturer's guidelines.
Remove dirt and material from tracks and equipment surfaces.

tasks.task: Pre-start check of a crawler tractor
Pre-start check of a crawler tractor.
subtasks: Inspect crawler attachment for worn or damaged parts.
Check tracks for worn components.
Inspect hydraulic fluid hoses and cylinders.
Check fluid levels and drain fuel tank.
Inspect engine's air filter system.
Check battery and connections.
Record hours of engine operation.
Start engine and warm-up.
Listen for engine and equipment noises.
Check operation of controls and systems.
Monitor equipment performance.
Adjust track tension.
Park and secure the tractor.
Perform post-operation maintenance.
Document the shutdown and next start.
